meanings.definition: A pin or bolt forming a pivot or axis for a wheel or other rotating part.
meanings.sent1: The trunnions on the bicycle wheel allow it to spin smoothly.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the trunnions are securely in place to prevent any wobbling.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the trunnions as a makeshift merry-go-round.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas served as the trunnions around which the project revolved.
meanings.sent5: The trunnions, like tiny hinges, kept the door of opportunity open.

meanings.definition: A pivot or axle at the end of a cannon.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers carefully adjusted the trunnions of the cannon before firing.
meanings.sent2: The trunnions of the old cannon showed signs of wear from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The trunnions of the cannon were so rusty that they squeaked when turned.
meanings.sent4: The trunnions of the cannon stood tall like guardians protecting the fort.
meanings.sent5: With a loud bang, the trunnions launched the cannonball into the sky.
